column4: when installing ubuntu 11.04 onto my computer that only has a 'broken' windows 7 os, in the 'Allocate drive space' step, it said "This computer currently has no detected operating systems. What would you like to do?" how can i access my windows files (trying to save my mp3s), does anyone know?"
Well, not sure what has happened.  You might try the LiveCD and see what you have.
i have the ubuntu 8 live cd, will that work?
You should be able to do it from the LiveCD
sorry, i know you're very busy; can anyone tell me how to access windows files to copy them to an external drive
Mount the partition and plug in a thumb drive and copy the files over.
thank you; stupid question: how do i mount the partition?

If you don't see any GUI for it, go to a terminal and first type   sudo fdisk -l   to see where the partitions are so that you can dermine which one will contain the mp3s you are wanting.  Then, (once you've discovered which partition it is), mount it with command:  sudo mount /dev/sda2 /mnt  And then   cd /mnt  and start looking for them.  ls
thank you very much! i'll try that
Once you find them plug in the USB device and see where it is mounted to and then use the  cp  command to copy them over.  But if you find a GUI UI for it, I'm sure you will find it easier.
i'm very sorry if this is a mess, but can you make sense of this? Disk /dev/sda: 80.0 GB, 80032038912 bytes
how do i tell if they are on partition 1 or 2?
sorry to bother you again! i'm not able to see my usb drive in "places"
unplug and plug it back in again.
i'm running ubuntu 11 so i can't i don' think
